headline.main: FBI AGENT ACCUSED AGAIN AT SPY TRIAL; Demanded Aid in Espionage Under Threat of Reprisals, Defendant Says

lead_paragraph: William G. Sebold, counter-espionage agent for the Federal Bureau of Investigation and principal government witness at the Brooklyn espionage trial, was pictured again yesterday in testimony as a self-confessed Nazi agent who attempted to lure German-Americans into an espionage ring under threats of reprisals by the Gestapo against their relatives still in Germany.
abstract: F J Stigler testifies on meetings with Sebold
